revision.comment: [[WP:AES|←]]Created page with ''''Ibrahim Faisal''' is the incumbent Tourism Minister of Maldives, a [[Maldives|Maldivian]] politician who earlier served as deputy minister in the Ministry of Youth and Sports from 2013 to 2015.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Ibrahim Faisal Appointed Tourism Minister of the Maldives |url=https://www.traveltrademaldives.com/ibrahim-faisal-appointed-tourism-minister-of-the-maldives/ |access-date=2023-11-20 |website=TRAVELTRADEMALDIVES.COM |language=en-US}}</ref> He...'
revision.text:
'''Ibrahim Faisal''' is the incumbent Tourism Minister of Maldives, a [[Maldives|Maldivian]] politician who earlier served as deputy minister in the Ministry of Youth and Sports from 2013 to 2015.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Ibrahim Faisal Appointed Tourism Minister of the Maldives |url=https://www.traveltrademaldives.com/ibrahim-faisal-appointed-tourism-minister-of-the-maldives/ |access-date=2023-11-20 |website=TRAVELTRADEMALDIVES.COM |language=en-US}}</ref> He also served as an additional secretary at the High Commission of Maldives in Malaysia From 2015 to 2018.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Auditor's report reveals misuse of embassy funds |url=https://avas.mv/en/78606 |access-date=2023-11-20 |website=avas.mv |language=en}}</ref>
== Personal life == Faisal is the son of Abdulla Raheem Abdulla, who was MP for Fonadhoo constituency as well as the deputy leader of the [[Progressive Party of Maldives]] (PPM).<ref>{{Cite web |last=raajje.mv |title=Ex-MP's son spent over MVR 70,000 from Maldives mission in Malaysia, on Prada glasses: report |url=https://raajje.mv/71849 |access-date=2023-11-20 |website=raajje.mv |language=en}}</ref>
== References == [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Tourism ministers of the Maldives]] [[Category:People from Malé]] [[Category:Government ministers of the Maldives]]

[[File:Ibrahim_Faisal_portrait.jpg|thumb|right]] '''Ibrahim Faisal''' is the incumbent Tourism Minister of Maldives, a [[Maldives|Maldivian]] politician who earlier served as deputy minister in the Ministry of Youth and Sports from 2013 to 2015.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Ibrahim Faisal Appointed Tourism Minister of the Maldives |url=https://www.traveltrademaldives.com/ibrahim-faisal-appointed-tourism-minister-of-the-maldives/ |access-date=2023-11-20 |website=TRAVELTRADEMALDIVES.COM |language=en-US}}</ref> He also served as an additional secretary at the High Commission of Maldives in Malaysia From 2015 to 2018.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Auditor's report reveals misuse of embassy funds |url=https://avas.mv/en/78606 |access-date=2023-11-20 |website=avas.mv |language=en}}</ref>
== Personal life == Faisal is the son of Abdulla Raheem Abdulla, who was MP for Fonadhoo constituency as well as the deputy leader of the [[Progressive Party of Maldives]] (PPM).<ref>{{Cite web |last=raajje.mv |title=Ex-MP's son spent over MVR 70,000 from Maldives mission in Malaysia, on Prada glasses: report |url=https://raajje.mv/71849 |access-date=2023-11-20 |website=raajje.mv |language=en}}</ref>
== References == [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Tourism ministers of the Maldives]] [[Category:People from Malé]] [[Category:Government ministers of the Maldives]]

{{Short description|Maldivian politician}}{{Infobox officeholder | name = Ismail Shafeeu | office = [[Ministry of Education (Maldives)|Minister of Education]] | term_start = 17 November 2023 | office = Minister of tourism [[Maldives]] | image =Ibrahim_Faisal_portrait.jpg | president =[[Mohamed Muizzu]] }} '''Ibrahim Faisal''' is the incumbent Tourism Minister of Maldives, a [[Maldives|Maldivian]] politician who earlier served as deputy minister in the Ministry of Youth and Sports from 2013 to 2015.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Ibrahim Faisal Appointed Tourism Minister of the Maldives |url=https://www.traveltrademaldives.com/ibrahim-faisal-appointed-tourism-minister-of-the-maldives/ |access-date=2023-11-20 |website=TRAVELTRADEMALDIVES.COM |language=en-US}}</ref> He also served as an additional secretary at the High Commission of Maldives in Malaysia From 2015 to 2018.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Auditor's report reveals misuse of embassy funds |url=https://avas.mv/en/78606 |access-date=2023-11-20 |website=avas.mv |language=en}}</ref>
== Personal life == Faisal is the son of Abdulla Raheem Abdulla, who was MP for Fonadhoo constituency as well as the deputy leader of the [[Progressive Party of Maldives]] (PPM).<ref>{{Cite web |last=raajje.mv |title=Ex-MP's son spent over MVR 70,000 from Maldives mission in Malaysia, on Prada glasses: report |url=https://raajje.mv/71849 |access-date=2023-11-20 |website=raajje.mv |language=en}}</ref>
== References == [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Tourism ministers of the Maldives]] [[Category:People from Malé]] [[Category:Government ministers of the Maldives]]
